description: The game is simple and fun. I enjoyed the game PERIOD. There is no BUT  Great gateway game.

title: A weaker, ...
description: A weaker, albeit surprisingly fun take on what Splendor did a couple years before it. I like the card drafting mechanism and resource conversion a lot and can see it hitting the table with some regularity.

title: Spice Road...
description: Spice RoadThe fastest and most distilled representation of the fun the century system offers.- 8/10

title: Slick game...
description: Slick game, good system. Looking forward to future expansions. My wife is a big fan. -1 for the lame cubes.

title: Tableau bu...
description: Tableau builder, a bit like Splendor, so interested to learn more about this game. Rating based on 1st play with 2 players, which was alright.

title: Love the m...
description: Love the mechanics and speed of this game

title: Amazing ga...
description: Amazing game. The whole family enjoys playing this game. Not too long and not too short. Love the theme and artwork. Great!!!

title: A great ga...
description: A great game to play with wife and with casuals for a couples game night.  Easy to teach, everyone grasps it right away and gets into building their engine.  While I personally prefer the look and components of the Golem edition, the theme there tends to turn off casuals while Spice Road is more appealing.

title: You turn c...
description: You turn cubes into cubes into cubes into cubes...

title: The theme ...
description: The theme can completely be taken out of this one as it is really just a pure engine building/resource management race. You just get cubes to get more cubes to turn into other cubes so that you can score points. It's so simple and yet I just can't get enough of it! I like heavier games for sure but this game is just pure fun to me and it's actually a game my kids can play too!

title: Use your c...
description: Use your cards to trade spices and claim victory points. Game runs pretty quickly and scales nicely regardless of how many players you play with. Like most other similar games where there's a communal card/resource area, I prefer to play with 2 players.

title: Interestin...
description: Interesting and light. In general, I think I like Splendor more (which is very similar). Splendor is a bit tighter and feels less random.

title: 7/19/17 Ea...
description:
7/19/17 Easy to learn game with deep strategy. Quickly has become on of my favorites. Not replacing Splendor, but a good alternative. Developed a house rule for the game, would like to try it sometime with 4 or 5 players.
Update 1/4/18: Now own the promo pack for the game. Still a top 3 game that hits the table

title: Not worth ...
description:
Not worth playing at 2 players. 3 players was good. My play was very very quiet though. The game was quick and easy to learn. Quick to play. Many times people were waiting for someone to take their turn but it was their turn already and they had no idea.

I need to play this a few more times to figure my opinion out better. I don't think it is trending in a positive direction over all though.
